intro: Cortusa gmelinii, commonly known as the meadow bellflower, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its clusters of bell-shaped blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist meadows and woodland edges, preferring well-drained soil. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a slightly hairy texture. Cortusa gmelinii is valued in gardens for its ornamental flowers and ability to thrive in partial shade.
